byline.contributor: Matt Furber reported from Minneapolis, and Mitch Smith from Chicago.
byline.original: By MATT FURBER and MITCH SMITH

abstract: Police Officers Mark Ringgenberg and Dustin Schwarze will face no charges for fatal shooting of unarmed black man Jamar Clark in Minneapolis in November; decision by prosecutor Mike Freeman is met with protests.
lead_paragraph: The two officers involved in the death of Mr. Clark, an unarmed black man shot during a confrontation, acted with justification, the prosecutor said.

headline.main: Minneapolis Officers in Jamar Clark Shooting Will Not Face Charges
headline.print_headline: Minneapolis Officers Won’t Face Charges in Shooting of a Black Man

snippet: The two officers involved in the death of Mr. Clark, an unarmed black man shot during a confrontation, acted with justification, the prosecutor said.

keywords.value: Ringgenberg, Mark A (Minneapolis, Minn, Police Officer )
